post-text: I don't think there's any question about that, and I resent it. I resent it. My parents came to this country as immigrants.
label: Appeal to Emotion

pre-text: I see what it does.
text: <Communism is the enemy of all religions; and we who do believe in God must join together.>
post-text: We must not be divided on this issue.
label: Appeal to Emotion

text: <What about the prices you pay? We find that the prices you pay went up five times as much in the Truman Administration as they did in the Eisenhower Administration.>
post-text: What's the net result of this?
label: False Causality (Post Hoc Fallacy)

pre-text: Now the present Administration-the President-has said-never indicated what he thought of the 1954 decision.
text: <Unless the president speaks, then of course uh-the country doesn't speak, and Franklin Roosevelt said: "The pre-uh-the presidency of the United States is above all a place of moral leadership.">
post-text: And I believe on this great moral issue he should speak out and give his views clearly.
label: Appeal to Authority

text: <One of them happened just the other day, when a man I admire and respect -- I've written about him -- Congressman John Lewis, an American hero, made allegations that Sarah Palin and I were somehow associated with the worst chapter in American history, segregation, deaths of children in church bombings, George Wallace. That, to me, was so hurtful.>
post-text: And, Senator Obama, you didn't repudiate those remarks.
label: Appeal to Emotion

text: <We had a substantial increase in new permits for housing.>
post-text: As a matter of fact, based on the announcement this week, there will be at an annual rate of a million, eight hundred and some thousand new houses built, which is a tremendous increase over last year and a substantial increase over the earlier part of this year. Now in addition, we had a very-some very good news in the reduction in the rate of inflation.
label: Appeal to Emotion

text: <Obviously, I'm hoping to earn your vote, I'm hoping to be elected in November, and I can promise you, I will work with every American. I want to be the president for all Americans, regardless of your political beliefs, where you come from, what you look like, your religion. I want us to heal our country and bring it together because that's, I think, the best way for us to get the future that our children and our grandchildren deserve.>
post-text: Well, I actually agree with that.
label: Appeal to Emotion

text: <Because this is the stimulation, the incentive for companies to go out and explore for oil, to develop it. If we didn't have a depletion allowance of certainly, I believe, the present amount, we would have our oil exploration cut substantially in this country.>
post-text: Now, as far as my position then is concerned, it is exactly opposite to the Senator's.
label: False Causality (Post Hoc Fallacy)

text: <Asking the wealthy to pay a little bit more along with cuts so that we can invest in education like yours.>
post-text: And let's take the money that we've been spending on war over the last decade to rebuild America, roads, bridges schools. We do those things, not only is your future going to be bright but America's future is going to bright as well. Well what you're seeing in this country is 23 million people struggling to find a job.
label: Slippery Slope
